name: Hostel Alamo

reviews.text: Here's what you can expect here: hotel-quality linens and towels, dorm beds made up daily by the housekeeper, excellent breakfast by Argentinian standards, outstanding location across from a giant Carrefour supermarket/megastore and still close to charming city parks, friendly and pleasant staff. Really, a great place to stay as a homebase to explore lovely Mendoza!
reviews.title: More like a bed and breakfast; very nice!

reviews.text: This is a great hostal, clean, ,icely located, affordable, helpful and with good breakfast and amazing bathrooms. Also the rooms upstairs are great, but I had the bad luck to be dropped in a lesser room, which really influenced my sleep ( and that is still the mainreason to come to a hostel right ). Therefore I cannot give a five, although it probably deserves it. Oh, the patio and communal room are great, but don t expect anything of the pool, it is mini.
reviews.title: Pity I cannot give it the five stars

reviews.text: Beautiful garden, clean shared areas and breakfast provided.
reviews.title: Top hostel in Mendoza!

reviews.text: Service was very good on reception and made to feel very welcome even by the hostel cat Momo!
reviews.title: Great Hostel
Nice hostel with good atmosphere
reviews.text: Great location by one of the central squares, recommended to all backpackers wanting to spend some time in lovely Mendoza.

I stayed in Hostel Alamo for the better part of 3.5 months (February 2011 thru mid-May 2011) -- and I can say, without exaggeration, that I have never met a more accommodating staff at any establishment in any of my travels, ever! Rooms and shared areas (including bathrooms!) were always clean, the backyard is beautiful and well-kept, the pool (though small) is refreshing and clean, the staff is willing to help (in English or Spanish) at all hours, it's relaxing and quiet, and I always felt safe and secure. Hostel Alamo is a short walk from Aristedes, the "backpacker" street full of (louder) hostels, bars, and clubs -- and for this short walk you can go out all night and be able to sleep peacefully when you get back to Alamo. The hostel is also a block (or less) from Carrefour, a few blocks from coffee shops (in all directions), bakeries, a bank, and Mercado Central. Convenient location, fantastic people, peace and quiet. The rooms can be a little dark/stuffy, but never be afraid to ask for something if you need it -- an extra blanket or a fan.
reviews.title: My favorite hostel!

reviews.text: **I had to check a "when did you travel" but I put my real dates in this review.
reviews.title: Great experience at Hostel Alamo
Great location
reviews.text: The staff at Hostel Alamo were very good, and knew quite a bit of English for those who needed it. They were always more than capable of suggesting fabulous things to do in Mendoza, and the surrounding areas, they even organized a shuttle ride to take us about an hour out of the city for kayaking and a resort area. They have a decent size kitchen for cooking, as well as an asado, and if you don't know how to use one, don't worry because they will help you. There was a sink both inside and outside of the restroom which was convenient if you needed to wash your hands and someone was taking a shower or something like that. The rooms were good sized and the beds were super comfortable. It was a very clean hostel, and I felt incredibly safe. There is a nice "backyard" which is great for socializing and meeting people, as well as eating meals. They do have a TV, and quite a few books to borrow and read. All in all, I had a fantastic experience with Hostel Alamo and would recommend it over any other hostels I have stayed in, one last thing, it's location is GREAT!!!

Location was great but the rooms were not well-ventilated. It was the peak of summer and it was really hot and stuff (at least in my room upstairs). The closets that doubled as lockers were huge and definitely a plus.
reviews.title: Not a bad choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has great location. It is located in a well kept house and not even one block from Plaza Chile, one of the four small plazas, a bank and a supermarket. Many good restaurants and bars are within easy walking distance. The street is fairly busy, but we had no problem with any noise in our (second) room.
reviews.title: Careful Which Double You Choose

reviews.text: Really liked this hostel. Not too fancy, small but nice 2-3 person wading pool in the back lounge/patio area. Really nice staff. Helped me get to the wineries by collectivo, saving me quite a buck, and brought up the exact route so I knew where to go, and what bus to catch. Max, Agus, and Matias, I believe, great folks all. Daily cleaning of rooms, making of the beds. Wasn't looking for a party hostel and this was perfect. Someone always grilling on their great Parilla, (it is argentina afterall). Good atmosphere, people coming from wineries, so always decent vino around. Just off one of the main streets and right near a market so getting food, supplies, or heading to the parque San Martin was quite easy. I extended my stay 1 or 2 days, as I had time to kill. Very good hostal. Shower heads need replacing, and dorms of 8 people can be a drag, but I still had to give 5 stars.
reviews.title: Everything you need, free towels and they make your bed daily!

reviews.text: the people was so nice and hostel is so clean and locacion is just perfect, i can hardly recemend this place.. it was the best place so far in latin america. i was here in new year and we had a lovely new years party in back garden. if you ever go to mendoza please go to here.
reviews.title: just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic private room in a hostel. Reasonable size but a bit dark and smelt slightly of drains. Bed uncomfortable with very poorly fitting sheet. Breakfast very basic. Staff helpful but always seemed too busy to really ask questions. That said at $30 USD a night it was good value.
reviews.title: Good value basic hostel

reviews.text: The hostel is locate in a nice house, with a internal garden. The structure as kitchen and tv room are nice. They have a computer with internet that you can use. It is locate in a nice place, close to Plaza Chile and not too far from main plaza. There is a Carrefour just in the block ahead.
reviews.title: Nice Hostel but not so good room
Peaceful hostel
reviews.text: Staff was really nice and helpful. But there was some issues that bothered me. In my opinion is a good cost benefit if you stay in the dorm or private room with shared bathroom. I stayed and paid for one of the premiun room, with private bathroom and TV, which was more expensive. I am not complaint about the price, as I agreed before on that, but I expected better things. TV was not working, but I just realized that on my last day. No hair dryer on bathroom, while on the shared bathroom had one.The shower did not have a good pressure and water was not plenty. The owner tried to help and apologized about the tv , which was nice, but just my opinion, when you have a business like that you need to plan ahead and forecast a new tv before it broken down ( from what I understood, he already had thought to change it) and not think to buy a new one after that. I think if that did not happen it would be a nice room, as it was big and airy. The bathroom was also spacious.

Hostel Alamo was a great additional to our trip in Mendoza. The staff members are all very helpful and friendly, and give some great recommendations for activities, eating, etc around the area. They also all speak English very well, if needed. The rooms are clean, quiet and relaxing and are great value. Our favorite was the courtyard area, which comes equipped with lots of sunshine, an asado, small pool, covered patio and Momo, the friendly hostel cat. It's a great area to meet new people, have drinks, play cards or relax. Overall, Hostel Alamo made us feel very at home.
reviews.title: Great value, location and staff

reviews.text: Hostel Alamo, like most reviews on tripadvisor and hostelworld seem to confirm, is a beautiful, friendly and well designed hostel. The receptionists are incredibly friendly and helpful (especially Max), the location is perfect (a 5 minute walk to plaza independencia), the dorm rooms are spacious and very clean (my room had a big balcony looking out over the backyard), the kitchen well equip, and there are a number of lovely communal areas including a tv room, dining area and backyard complete with bbq and small pool. I stayed for 4 nights and arranged a few wine tours through the hostel which was very hassle free and enjoyable. The vibe of the hostel is great as there are areas to relax, play guitar, dip your legs in the pool (it's not big enough for much else!) or watch a movie, as well as areas to drink wine and meet other people. While they don't offer free wine, asados or a massive pool like some other places, I don't think you could beat the price, location, vibe and design of this beautiful place. I was very happy with my decision and would definitely stay here on any return visits to Mendoza.
reviews.title: One of my favourite hostels in Sth America

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hostel with lovely spacious rooms. We stayed in two different rooms, and both were very comfortable. Max was very organised and very helpful. Hostel well located. The hostel had a lovely feel to it, with nice areas to relax in, both outside and inside.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: I stayed at Hostel Alamo when I was between buses from Buenos Aires to Santiago. I was not feeling well and did not want to do much. It was a great place to relax and recover. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. There is a nice pool and backyard patio. It is very clean and comfortable with decent prices.
reviews.title: Comfortable
Friendly staff, clean rooms, good value.
reviews.text: We found this hostel through tripadvisor so its only fair we leave a review to support it. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. The internet wasn't working well when we first arrived and by the next day, Fernando, the owner had 3 other networks available to use! Rooms are cleaned and beds made everyday. The upstairs dorm rooms can get very hot and the ceiling fans don't do much, but I've heard since then they've bought industrial fans to help reduce this. The courtyard is nice and green, complete with a little dip pool and parilla. The common areas have air conditioning which is great for the extremely hot days in Mendoza. We also stayed in an apartment owned by the hostel which is right off Plaza Independencia and we were able to negotiate a discount for staying for a fortnight (even in high season). Small but sufficient, aircon, internet, kitchen, hot water, and cable TV. I would definitely stay with Hostel Alamo again.

description: Welcome to Our Hostel...Bienvenidos! Hostel Alamo is among the most recent additions to Mendoza's hostel circuit. Once a family residence, we have renovated this beautiful and spacious home into a modern 14-bedroom hostel, while maintaining the integrity and charm of its original colonial style.The house was built in 1944 by the late architect Daniel Ramos Correa, who has made many significant architectural contributions to Mendoza, including participation in the city's main square, Plaza Independencia, and the Frank Romero Day Ampitheater, where the National Grape Harvest (Vendimia) Celebration is held annually. The lovely enclosed garden, terraces, fireplaces, and numerous windows throughout help to create the positive and cozy environment that is Hostel Alamo. Ideal Location...Hostel Alamo is conveniently located in the heart of downtown Mendoza, just a few blocks away from the main shopping and dining district. Literally just around the corner you’ll find one of the city’s newest and finest supermarkets, a bank, an internet and telephone cafe, a laundry facility, souvenir shops, kiosks, and a gas station, just to name a few.By car, we are merely 10 minutes from el Parque San Martín, 15 minutes from the bus terminal and 25 minutes from Mendoza’s Francisco Gabrielli Airport (better known as El Plumerillo).Our Mission...Hostel Alamo is owner-operated and together with our bilingual team, we strive to provide our guests with the highest standard of customer service with a personal touch.We make every effort to maintain a clean, comfortable, and relaxing atmosphere where our guests will always feel welcome and safe. Join us!...We hope you'll stay with us as you discover the natural wonders of Mendoza, Argentina and the rich culture of her people. Whether you wish to taste a typical Mendocinian Malbec during a tour of one of the city’s numerous bodegas, or spend the day in the mountains skiing or hiking, it would be our pleasure to arrange any excursion for you right here at Hostel Alamo.Or if you prefer, relax in our garden while you read a book and soak in some Argentinean sun, prepare an elaborate meal in our kitchen, or just stretch out on our sofa and enjoy a movie from our international DVD collection. However you plan to enjoy yourself in Mendoza, we hope you’ll allow Hostel Alamo to be your home away from home!
